<br>
<br>

_D. mackayi_ has been found at one location in Louisiana during this study. Very little information is known about this particular sponge. The scientific literature is very limited. We were able to locate this organism in a stagnant water system off the Pearl River. Stay tuned for images of this organism!

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(sf)
library(rgdal)
library(sp)
library(readxl)
library(ggspatial)
library(ggmap)
library(RColorBrewer)
```

```{r echo=FALSE, results='hide', message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
states<-st_read("map_data_files/states")
la.b<-st_crop(states,xmin=-94.15,xmax=-89,ymin=29,ymax=33.15)
la.c<-states[states$STATE_NAME=="Louisiana",]
sites<-read_xlsx("map_data_files/Miller_sponge gps coordinates_summer 2021.xlsx", sheet="Dm")
```

```{r map, echo=FALSE, fig.align='center', fig.asp=.95}
(map1<-ggplot()+
    geom_sf(data=la.c)+
    geom_point(aes(x=Long,y=Lat, color=Dm),data=sites,size=3)+
    scale_color_brewer(palette = "Dark2",name="Duosclera mackayi")+
    ylab("Latitude")+
    xlab("Longitude")+
    theme_set(theme_bw())+ 
    theme(panel.grid = element_blank())+
    theme(legend.position="none")+
    theme(axis.text = element_text(size=10,family="sans"),
          axis.title= element_text(size=12,family="sans")))
```
